intro: Schoepfiopsis, commonly known as the mistletoe of the genus Schoepfiopsis, is a type of parasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its lack of chlorophyll, relying entirely on its host for nutrients. The plant produces small, often inconspicuous flowers and berries that may be dispersed by birds. It is found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant ecological impacts on its host trees.
